intro: Senecio webbii, commonly known as the Webbi's groundsels, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Senecio webbii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
